I asked them about their plans for the weekend and wrote a few things down on the board. Then they guessed what the others are up to. ACTIVITY 1: Five Things to Do on Your Weekends Before asking students what they like to do at the weekend tell them that today we are going to practise talking about five things we enjoy doing. First, we have to think of some things to put into the boxes. I usually allow a minute or two. Maybe? Ask students to work in pairs. Suggest one example for them at the top of the page. If you enjoy listening to music Tell students to brainstorm them all as a group. What else do you like to do? ACTIVITY 2: Have you ever? Next I want you to think about the five things I wrote on the board. Which ones have you actually done in your life and which ones haven't you done? Show this picture to help them organise the answers. I also tell them what I wrote and how often I have done each thing. If you have done them, you can put a tick. Have you ever played football? Yes, I have a few times. Have you ever visited a country you've never been to before? You write down what you have done and put an X next to the other things you haven't done yet. Have you ever watched a movie? Yes, I have four times. I haven't been to Washington. I have travelled to Greece in the past.

1. if + subject + present form + main verb\PremiÃ¨rement, on utilise 'if' suivi du sujet et du verbe au prÃ©sent pour faire le conditionnel prÃ©sent.\Par exemple, si toute la famille mange avec les doigts, elle doit nettoyer trÃ¨s bien.\Si tout le monde mangeait avec les doigts, elle devrait tout nettoyer.2. if + subject + would + present form + main verb\Dans la deuxiÃ¨me forme, on utilise 'would' au lieu de 'if'. two things people do not know how to say in English.
"Quoi?" is the question "What?" and "Quelle?" is the question "Which?".
In English, there are multiple ways to ask "What?". For example:

What's that?
What is this?
In the flipped classroom video lesson that follows, I'll teach you exactly how to say these things in French.

Original: Quiconque aurait la dans mon coeur en son absence m'aurait pris pour un sÃ©ducteur froid et peu sensible ; quiconque m'eÃ»t aperÃ§u Ã  ses cÃ´tÃ©s eÃ»t cru reconnaÃ®tre en moi un amant novice, interdit et passionnÃ©.
Simplified:
Quelqu'un qui n'avait rien dans mon coeur lorsque nous n'Ã©tions pas ensemble aurait pu penser que j'Ã©tais un sÃ©ducteur froid, pas trop douÃ© avec le coeur et qui ne savait pas trop comment Ãªtre avec les filles ; et quelqu'un qui m'aurait vu avec elle aurait pu croire que j'Ã©tais un amant qui a tout le temps envie de lui et qui est trÃ¨s timide.	before reading the textSome people think that they can tell whether you love someone or not just by seeing you walk with them. I don't think that's true though. "There are many ways in which you can love people, " I would say. After all, you could spend a lot of time worrying about a friend who is in trouble, but the look on their face when they need you next to them is probably not the same as when you would be in love.
fewerI only really care for people who I spend a lot of time with, but I have never thought of any friend as someone I could love. I think I've thought about it this time though, but I'm not going to tell. I guess I could go on a secret date with this girl who smiled at me, but I don't know what would happen if everyone she knows found out.The last things I would want would be to be seen as a creep or to have to stop seeing her. I'm just not ready for a relationship.
I could be feeling completely different a few weeks from now though. I'll just have to wait and see what happens then. after reading the textSome people believe that people only show their true feelings when they are with people they love. I don't believe this, though. You can show people how you feel about them in different ways, and you may not even know it. For example, when you are worried about one of your best friends, you may spend a long time thinking about them. This could show that you care about them. The expression on their face when they need you to be with them would probably show their love. But it might not be how they look when you don't think about them, or when you are with a new person you like.
I wouldn't call any of my friends the people I really love, but I think that I might feel different about someone now. I would like to take her out somewhere quiet and talk while no one else is around. But I don't know what would happen if I told anyone we go out together. She might think I'm some sort of silly romantic person who is desperate for a girlfriend. I wouldn't want that, and I don't think that she likes me that way, so I would just have to stop seeing her.She might feel the same, or she might start dating me. We'll just have to wait and see. Figuring out what to say when you say the opposite of what you mean You don't always say exactly the same words when you are talking in English or French. You can leave words out sometimes or put them in when they aren't really needed. However, when you leave words out, you have to make new words up to show your meaning. Mots inutiles You often don't need to say certain words because they are easy to understand from what you say before or after. You don't need to tell people the name of something they can see. You can just say what it is. You can use your hand to show the name of something if you don't know its French.
